images.caption: Figure 1:MuseControlLite uses multiple condition extractors to handle all time-varying controls. The musical attribute offers control over elements such as melody, rhythm, and dynamics, whereas the audio condition enables audio inpainting and outpainting.We train the two pipelines separately with two sets of adapters, but users can choose to use either one or both at the inference time.

Figure 2:This figure consists of four attention maps: i) untrained, ii) trained, given full audio condition, iii) trained, inpainting 5th-25th seconds, and iv) trained, outpainting 10th seconds onward. After training, a portion of the attention maps exhibits a perfectly diagonal pattern when given the full audio condition.
When performing inpainting or outpainting (i.e., only partial audio condition is given), the model tends to reference previous keys, exhibiting effective usage of given audio context.
